lessons.what_went_wrong: Hypothesis assumed sparser anchor patterns (fewer hits) would improve regularity. Reality: regularity measures gap uniformity, not sparseness. euclidean(16,4) has even 4-step gaps; euclidean(16,3) has uneven 5,5,6-step gaps.
lessons.key_insight: Regularity requires uniform gap spacing, not fewer hits. euclidean(n,k) where n/k is an integer produces most regular patterns. 16/4=4 is better than 16/3=5.33.

regularity_theory.definition: Gap uniformity between hits, not pattern sparseness
regularity_theory.optimal_k_values: k values where n/k is an integer (for n=16: k=1,2,4,8,16)
regularity_theory.why_3_is_worse: euclidean(16,3) = gaps of [5,5,6] or similar = non-uniform

recommended_retry.approach: Investigate root cause of low stable zone regularity
questions: Why is regularity 0.56 when euclidean(16,4) should be ~1.0?
Is SHAPE varying within 'stable zone' test patterns?
Are shimmer/aux patterns reducing overall regularity?

side_effects_discovered.reason: Sparser anchor created more gaps for shimmer to fill

lessons.what_went_wrong: Lever operates on SHAPE parameter (0.70-0.77), but stable zone defined by ENERGY parameter (0.0-0.3). These don't overlap - low ENERGY patterns can have any SHAPE value.
lessons.key_insight: SHAPE levers don't affect ENERGY-defined zones. For zone-specific improvements, use levers that operate in the same parameter domain as the zone definition.

recommended_retry.rationale: These scale with ENERGY, directly affecting stable zone patterns

bootstrap_heuristic_updates.reason: Failed iteration proved SHAPE levers don't affect ENERGY zones

calibration_lessons: Don't assume linear scaling (10% lever ≠ 10% metric, actual: 25x weaker)
Sensitivity R²<0.5 indicates unreliable signal (70%+ unexplained variance)
Bootstrap heuristics need empirical validation before trusting

regularity_misconception.description: Confusing pattern sparseness with regularity (gap uniformity)
regularity_misconception.prevention: Remember: regularity = uniform gaps, not fewer hits
checklist: Does changing this lever affect gap uniformity or hit count?
For euclidean, check if n/k produces integer (uniform gaps)
Test specific patterns to verify gap uniformity effect

zone_vs_parameter_confusion.description: Attempting to improve a zone-specific metric with a lever that operates in a different parameter domain
zone_vs_parameter_confusion.prevention: Always verify: lever operating range ∩ target zone parameter range ≠ ∅
checklist: What parameter does the target zone use? (ENERGY, SHAPE, DRIFT, etc.)
What parameter does the lever affect?
If not, find a lever in the correct domain

bootstrap_overconfidence.description: Bootstrap heuristics with high confidence but low empirical validation
